info.title: Ashby API
info.description: The public API for accessing resources in your Ashby instance.

post.description:
Retrieve information about the API key being used to make the request.

**Requires the [`apiKeysRead`](authentication#permissions-apikeyinfo) permission.**

title.description: The name of the API key.

post.description:
Change the source of an application.

**Requires the [`candidatesWrite`](authentication#permissions-applicationchangesource) permission.**

allOf.description: The id of the application to update the source of
The source to set on the application. Pass null to unset an application's source.

post.description:
Change the stage of an application

**Requires the [`candidatesWrite`](authentication#permissions-applicationchangestage) permission.**

allOf.description: The id of the application to update the stage of
The interview stage to move the application to.

Archive Reason to set when moving to an Interview Stage with type: `Archived`. 
Note: You must pass this parameter when moving to an Interview Stage with type: `Archived`

The id of the communication template to use for the email.
Note: This communication template's intendedTypes must include: `email`.

sendAt.description:
The date and time to send the email as an ISO 8601 date and time string, e.g. `2025-02-24T08:27:01Z`.
If omitted, the email will be scheduled for the following morning at 9:32am in your default timezone.
If the time is in the past, the email will be sent immediately.
Note: If a timezone is not specified, timestamps will be interpreted in UTC, regardless of your timezone setting.

archiveEmail.description:
Email to send to the candidate when moving to an Interview Stage with type: `Archived`.
Note: If application is already archived, the email will not be sent.
Note: If email send fails, the application stage will not be updated. If this is the case, you can retry the request without this parameter.
Note: You may only pass this parameter if the application is moving to an Interview Stage with type: `Archived`.

post.description:
Consider a candidate for a job

**Requires the [`candidatesWrite`](authentication#permissions-applicationcreate) permission.**

allOf.description: The id of the candidate to consider for a job
The id of the job to consider the candidate for
The id of the interview plan to place the application in. If none is provided, the default interview plan is used.

The interview stage of the interview plan (either default or provided) to place the application in. 
If none is provided, the application is placed in the first "Lead" stage. 
You can also supply the special string "FirstPreInterviewScreen", which will choose the first pre-interview-screen stage on the specified job's interview plan.
The source to set on the application being created.
The id of the user the application will be credited to.
An ISO date string to set the application's `createdAt` timestamp. When this value isn't provided, the `createdAt` timestamp defaults to the time the the call was made.
An array of objects representing the application history.
The ID of the interview stage for this history event. This stage must belong to the interview plan associated with the application.
The sort order of this event. 0 is the first, the highest number will be the current stage.
An ISO date string representing the time the application entered this stage.
The ID of the archive reason. If the interview stage is an `Archived` stage type, this field is required.
An array of objects representing the application history.

post.description:
Fetch application details by application id or by submitted form instance id (which is return by the `applicationForm.submit` endpoint). If both applicationId and submittedFormInstanceId are provided, we will lookup by applicationId.

**Requires the [`candidatesRead`](authentication#permissions-applicationinfo) permission.**

allOf.description: The id of the application to fetch.

expand.description: Choose to expand the result and include additional data for related objects.

allOf.description: The id of the application's submitted form instance to fetch.

expand.description: Choose to expand the result and include additional data for related objects.

openings.description: The openings array will only be included if the `openings` expand parameter is included when the request is made.

applicationFormSubmissions.description: Application form submissions. These match the response from the `applicationForm.submit` endpoint. Use of the expand parameter is required to fetch.

post.description:
Gets all applications in the organization.

**Requires the [`candidatesRead`](authentication#permissions-applicationlist) permission.**

createdAfter.description: The API will return data after this date, which is the time since the unix epoch in milliseconds

expand.description: Choose to expand the result and include additional data for related objects.

post.description:
Transfer an application to a different job.

**Requires the [`candidatesWrite`](authentication#permissions-applicationtransfer) permission.**

allOf.description: The id of the application to transfer.
The id of the job to transfer the application to.
The id of the interview plan to transfer the application to.
The interview stage of the interview plan to transfer the application to.

Whether to start any automatic activities set on the target interview stage. 
If not provided, the default value is `true`.

post.description:
Update an application

**Requires the [`candidatesWrite`](authentication#permissions-applicationupdate) permission.**

allOf.description: The id of the application to update
The source to set on the application being created.
The id of the user the application will be credited to.
An ISO date string to set the application's `createdAt` timestamp. When this value isn't provided, the `createdAt` timestamp defaults to the time the the call was made.

sendNotifications.description: Whether or not users who are subscribed to the application should be notified that application was updated. Default is true.

post.description:
Update the history of an application. This endpoint is used to update the history of an application, such as setting the entered stage time or deleting a history event.

**Requires the [`candidatesWrite`](authentication#permissions-applicationupdatehistory) permission and the `Allow updating application history?` setting found in your admin API key permissions configuration.**

allOf.description: The id of the application to fetch.

applicationHistory.description: The updated array of application history events. This array should contain all history events for the application, not just the events being updated.

stageNumber.title: Stage Number
stageNumber.description: The order of the history event in the application's history. 0 is the first event.

enteredStageAt.description: The time the application entered the stage.

applicationHistoryId.title: Application History ID
applicationHistoryId.description: The id of the application history event to update if you are updating an existing event.

archiveReasonId.title: Archive Reason ID
archiveReasonId.description: The id of the archive reason to associate with the history event if the stage type is `archived`.

applicationFormSubmissions.description: Application form submissions. These match the response from the `applicationForm.submit` endpoint. Use of the expand parameter is required to fetch.

post.description:
Fetch a paginated list of application history items for an application.

**Requires the [`candidatesRead`](authentication#permissions-applicationListHistory) permission.**

allOf.description: The id of the application to fetch.

moreDataAvailable.description: Whether the cursor can be used to fetch a subsequent page of data.

stageNumber.title: Stage Number
stageNumber.description: The order of the history event in the application's history. 0 is the first event.

allowedActions.title: Allowed Actions
allowedActions.description: Actions that can be performed on the application via `application.updateHistory`.

actorId.title: Actor ID
actorId.description: The ID of the user that performed the stage change.

post.description:
List all feedback associated with an application.

**Requires the [`candidatesRead`](authentication#permissions-applicationfeedbacklist) permission.**

The `submittedValues` field in the response contains the submitted feedback in an object where the key is the path of the field and the value is the value submitted for that field.

allOf.description: The id of the application you'd like to fetch feedback for

post.description:
Adds an Ashby user to the hiring team at the application level. 

**Requires the [`candidateWrite`](authentication#permissions-applicationaddhiringteammember) permission.**

allOf.description: The application to assign the user a role on.
The id of the user to assign the role to.
The id of the hiring team role to assign.

post.description:
Removes an Ashby user to the hiring team at the application level. 

**Requires the [`candidateWrite`](authentication#permissions-applicationremovehiringteammember) permission.**

allOf.description: The application to unassign the user a role from.
The id of the user to unassign the role from.
The id of the hiring team role to unassign.

post.description:
Gets all available hiring team roles for applications in the organization.

**Requires the [`candidatesRead`](authentication#permissions-applicationHiringTeamRoleList) permission.**

Application feedback forms support a variety of field types. 

**Requires the [`candidatesWrite`](authentication#permissions-applicationfeedbacksubmit) permission.**

The values accepted for each field depend on the type of field that's being filled out:                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
- `Boolean` - A boolean value
- `Date` - A date string in the format YYYY-MM-DD
- `Email` - A valid email address
- `Number` - An integer
- `RichText` - We do not support submitting rich text documents via the API but we do support submitting plain text values for these fields. Plain text values must be submitted in the format `{ type: "PlainText", value: "A plain text string" }`
- `Score` - An integer between 1 and 4 submitted in the format `{ score: 4 }`
- `Phone`, `String` A string
- `ValueSelect` - A string that matches the value of one of the ValueSelect field's selectable options
- `MultiValueSelect` - An array of strings that exist in the MultiValueSelect field's selectable options

The `submittedValues` field in the response contains the submitted feedback in an object where the key is the path of the field and the value is the value submitted for that field.

allOf.description: The id of the feedback form definition associated with the form submission
The id of the application you're submitting feedback for

The id of the user the feedback will be credited to.
If a userId is not provided, the feedback will be credited to the API key user.
The id of the feedback form definition associated with the form submission
The id of the application you're submitting feedback for

The id of the user the feedback will be credited to. 
The user must be an interviewer on the interview event that feedback is being submitted for.
The id of the interview event you're submitting feedback for.

post.description:
Submit an application for a job posting.

**Requires the [`candidatesWrite`](authentication#permissions-applicationformsubmit) permission.**

The Content-Type of this request must be `multipart/form-data`.

**Note: The requests generated from this documentation will not work for this endpoint.**

The values accepted for each field depend on the type of field that's being filled out:                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
- `Boolean` - A boolean value
- `Date` - A date string in the format YYYY-MM-DD
- `Email` - A valid email address
- `Number` - An integer
- `RichText` - We do not support submitting rich text documents via the API but we do support submitting plain text values for these fields. Plain text values must be submitted in the format `{ type: "PlainText", value: "A plain text string" }`
- `Score` - An integer between 1 and 4 submitted in the format `{ score: 4 }`
- `Phone`, `String` A string
- `ValueSelect` - A string that matches the value of one of the ValueSelect field's selectable options
- `MultiValueSelect` - An array of strings that exist in the MultiValueSelect field's selectable options
- `Location` - An object with the following properties: `{ country: "USA", city: "San Francisco", region: "California" }`. You may provide any combination of these properties and we will attempt to geocode the location. For best results, provide all three properties.

allOf.description: The id of the job posting to submit an application for

tagIds.description: The ids of the tags to apply to the candidate

allowSubmissionForUnpublishedJobPosting.description: Defaults to true. If you are running a custom built careers page that is statically generated, you may want to set this to true to allow applications to be submitted in the time a job is unpublished and your careers page is refreshed. If set to false, applications submitted for unpublished job postings will return a `job_posting_not_published` error.

\u003Cfile key\u003E.description: Any file referenced  in the `applicationForm`.   The name of this field must exactly match the `value` on the `fieldSubmission` that references this file.

blockMessageForCandidateHtml.description: A message to display to the candidate if they been blocked from applying due to application limits
blockMessageForCandidateHtml.example: In order to give as many candidates as possible an opportunity to apply we have limiting the number of applications a single candidate may submit. Unfortunately we cannot, accept your application at this time.

post.description:
Create or update an approval definition for a specific entity that requires approval. The entity requiring approval must be within scope of an approval in Ashby that is marked as being managed by the API.

If the provided approval step definitions is an empty list, then approval will be skipped and the entity will proceed to the next stage.

**Requires the [`approvalsWrite`](authentication#permissions-approvaldefinitionupdate) permission.**

allOf.description: The id of the approval entity being updated (e.g. the id of the offer version).

approvalStepDefinitions.description: An ordered list of approval steps that describes the number of required approvers at each step, as well as who is an approver at each step.

approvalsRequired.description: The number of approvers required to approve this step, before the approval moves on to the next step. The number of approvers must be non-zero and no more than the number of approvers in this step.

approvers.description: An unordered list of who can approve this step.

allOf.description: The id of a user who is an approver for this step.

submitApprovalRequest.description:
Control whether an approval request created through this API should be immediately submitted.
If false, then the approval will need to be manually submitted in the Ashby app.
Default: false

allOf.description: The id of the approval definition.
The id of the approval entity (e.g. the id of the offer version).

post.description:
Lists archive reasons

**Requires the [`hiringProcessMetadataRead`](authentication#permissions-archivereasonlist) permission.**

includeArchived.description: When true, includes archived interview plans

post.description:
Add a completed assessment to a candidate

**Requires the [`candidatesWrite`](authentication#permissions-assessmentaddcompletedtocandidate) permission.**

allOf.description: The id of the candidate, to whom to add the completed assessment
The id of the partner adding the assessment
An identifier that uniquely identifies the assessment type
An identifier that uniquely identifies the completed assessment

assessmentName.description: The name of the assessment that was taken that will be displayed in the UI

allOf.description: The assessment's result

metadata.description: An array of metadata associated with this completed assessment

allOf.description: The timestamp in milliseconds since the unix epoch, when the assessment was completed
The timestamp in milliseconds since the unix epoch, when the update occurred

identifier.description: Uniquely identifies this field, for this partner

label.description: Label for the assessment metadata to be displayed in the UI

description.description: Description of the assessment metadata, which may be displayed in the UI
description.example: The maximum possible score for the assessment

type.description: The type of the value. Please reach out if you'd like us to support a new type!

allOf.description: The raw value  one of string, number, or boolean

post.description: The API for starting an assessment. Implemented by the partner, called by Ashby.

allOf.description: The id of the type of assessment to start (retrieved from calling /assessment.list)
Identifier of the assessment being started
A description of the candidate
The identifier of the candidate in Ashby
The first name of the candidate being assessed
The last name of the candidate being assessed
The email of the candidate being assessed
The url back into Ashby of the candidate being assessed
The application for which the candidate is being assessed
The application for which the candidate is being assessed
The id of the application in Ashby
The status of the application in Ashby
The job for which the candidate is being assessed
The job for which the candidate is being assessed
The id of the job in Ashby
The name of the job in Ashby
The customer-defined requisition id for the job
The url of the job, internal to Ashby

409.description: The assessment could not be started because the candidate is already being assessed.

422.description: A custom error message that will be shown to the user in Ashby.

message.description: The message to be shown to the user in Ashby.

post.description: The API for listing assessments that the partner supports  implemented by the partner, but called by Ashby

allOf.description: List of available assessments

post.description:
Update Ashby about the status of a started assessment.

**Requires the [`candidatesWrite`](authentication#permissions-assessmentupdate) permission.**

allOf.description: Identifier of the assessment being updated
The current status of the assessment. Setting this with a value of "Started" will signal Ashby to store the timestamp the assessment started.
The url back to the assessment/candidate on the partner's website. This value should always be of type url. (required when assessment_result is set)
The result of the assessment. Sending an update with this field will signal to Ashby that the assessment is complete.
The reason the assessment was cancelled. This field will signal to Ashby that the assessment is cancelled.

metadata.description: Any other metadata about the assessment (e.g. ETA until complete). All assessment data should have unique identifiers.

post.description: (Optional) Cancels an assessment. Implemented by the partner, called by Ashby.

allOf.description: The id of the started assessment to cancel

post.description:
Adds the candidate to a project.

**Requires the [`candidatesWrite`](authentication#permissions-candidateaddproject) permission.**

allOf.description: The id of the candidate
The id of the project

post.description:
Adds a tag to a candidate

**Requires the [`candidatesWrite`](authentication#permissions-candidateaddtag) permission.**

candidateId.description: The unique id of the candidate to add the tag to.

tagId.description: The unique id of the tag to add to the candidate.

post.description:
Anonymizes a candidate.

**Requires the [`candidatesWrite`](authentication#permissions-candidateanonymize) permission.**

**Note**: this action cannot be reversed and requires all of a candidate's applications to be in the archived or hired state.

allOf.description: The id of the candidate to anonymize.
The anonymized candidate

post.description:
Creates a new candidate

**Requires the [`candidatesWrite`](authentication#permissions-candidatecreate) permission.**

name.description: The first and last name of the candidate to be created.

allOf.description: Primary, personal email of the candidate to be created.
Primary, personal phone number of the candidate to be created.

linkedInUrl.description: Url to the candidate's LinkedIn profile. Must be a valid Url.

githubUrl.description: Url to the candidate's Github profile. Must be a valid Url.

website.description: Url of the candidate's website. Must be a valid Url.

alternateEmailAddresses.description: Array of alternate email address to add to the candidate's profile.

allOf.description: The source to set on the candidate being created.
The id of the user the candidate will be credited to.

city.description: The city of the candidate's location.

region.description: The region (state, province, etc.) of the candidate's location.

country.description: The country of the candidate's location.

allOf.description: An ISO date string to set the candidate's `createdAt` timestamp. When this value isn't provided, the `createdAt` timestamp defaults to the time the the call was made.

post.description:
Creates a note on a candidate.

**Requires the [`candidatesWrite`](authentication#permissions-candidatecreatenote) permission.**

For notes submitted with a type of `text/html`, we support the elements listed below. Any unsupported elements will be stripped out of the note's content before posting.
  - Bold `<b>`
  - Italic `<i>`
  - Underline `<u>`
  - Links `<a>`
  - Bulleted Lists - `<ul>`, `<li>`
  - Ordered Lists - `<ol>`, `<li>`
  - Code - `<code>`
  - Code Block - `<pre>`

oneOf.description: The note to add to the candidate
oneOf.example: Strong candidate, very interested in the company

type.description:
The content type of the note. For notes submitted with a type of text/html we support the elements listed below. Any unsupported elements will be stripped out of the note's content before posting.
- Bold `<b>`
- Italic `<i>`
- Underline `<u>`
- Links `<a>`
- Bulleted Lists - `<ul>`, `<li>`
- Ordered Lists - `<ol>`, `<li>`
- Code - `<code>`
- Code Block - `<pre>`

sendNotifications.description: Whether or not users who are subscribed to the candidate should be notified that the note was posted. Default is false.

content.example: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.

post.description:
Gets a single candidate by id.

**Requires the [`candidatesRead`](authentication#permissions-candidateinfo) permission.**

id.description: The id of the candidate to fetch

externalMappingId.description:
An id assigned to a candidate outside of Ashby. 
Used to associate Ashby candidates with their profiles in external systems (BambooHR, Rippling, Gusto, etc.)

id.description: The unique id of the candidate

applicationIds.description: The unique ids of all applications associated with the candidate

resumeFileHandle.description: The id, name and handle for the candidate's resume

fileHandles.description: The id, name and handle for each file associated with the candidate

handle.description: You can use the file handle to retrieve the file's URL by using the file.info endpoint.

customFields.description: All custom field values associated with the candidate

profileUrl.description: The url of the candidate's profile in Ashby

source.description: The source that created this candidate

creditedToUser.description: The user who receives credit for this user

primaryLocation.description: The primary location of the candidate

locationSummary.description: A human-readable summary of the location.

locationComponents.description: The individual components of the location.

type.description: The type of the location component.

name.description: The name of the location component.

post.description:
Lists all candidates in an organization

**Requires the [`candidatesRead`](authentication#permissions-candidatelist) permission.**

Lists all notes on a candidate

**Requires the [`candidatesRead`](authentication#permissions-candidatelistnotes) permission.**

allOf.description: The id of the candidate to fetch notes for

post.description:
Search for candidates by email and / or name. 

**Requires the [`candidatesRead`](authentication#permissions-candidatesearch) permission.**

Responses are limited to 100 results. Consider refining your search or using /candidate.list to paginate through all candidates, if you approach this limit. This API is for use cases where you intend operate on a final small set of candidates, like building a candidate autocomplete.

Note: When multiple search parameters are provided, the parameters are combined with the `AND` operator.

Updates an existing candidate

**Requires the [`candidatesWrite`](authentication#permissions-candidateupdate) permission.**

allOf.description: The unique id of the candidate to update.

name.description: The first and last name of the candidate to update.

allOf.description: Primary, personal email of the candidate to update.
Primary, personal phone number of the candidate to update.

alternateEmail.description: An alternate email address to add to the candidate's profile.

socialLinks.description:
An array of social links to set on the candidate. This value replaces existing socialLinks that have been set on the candidate. 
If this value is submitted along with linkedInUrl, gitHubUrl or websiteUrl fields, those values will be ignored.

allOf.description: The id of source for this candidate.
The id of the user the candidate will be credited to.
An ISO date string to set the candidate's `createdAt` timestamp.

sendNotifications.description: Whether or not users who are subscribed to the candidate should be notified that candidate was updated. Default is true.

post.description:
Uploads a file to attach to the candidate's profile. 

**Requires the [`candidatesWrite`](authentication#permissions-candidateuploadfile) permission.**

The `Content-Type` of this request must be `multipart/form-data`.

allOf.description: The id of the candidate

file.description: The file to upload to the candidate's profile

post.description:
Uploads a candidate's resume, parses it, and updates their information.

**Requires the [`candidatesWrite`](authentication#permissions-candidateuploadresume) permission.**

The `Content-Type` of this request must be `multipart/form-data`.

Note: Existing candidate data always takes precedence over data found by parsing the resume. Resume data only populates candidate data, if it's data that was missing in the candidate model.

allOf.description: The id of the candidate

resume.description: The resume to upload to the candidate's profile

post.description:
Creates a candidate tag.

**Requires the [`hiringProcessMetadataWrite`](authentication#permissions-candidatetagcreate) permission.**

title.description: The tag's title. If a tag already exists with that title, the existing tag will be returned.

results.description: A tag applied to a candidate

post.description:
Lists all candidate tags

**Requires the [`hiringProcessMetadataRead`](authentication#permissions-candidatetaglist) permission.**

includeArchived.description: Whether archived candidate tags should be included in the response

post.description:
List all enabled communication templates.

**Requires the [`hiringProcessMetadataRead`](authentication#permissions-communicationtemplatelist) permission.**

allOf.description: A communication template

post.description:
Create a new custom field

**Requires the [`hiringProcessMetadataWrite`](authentication#permissions-customfieldcreate) permission.**

fieldType.description: The type of field being created. This value is case-sensitive.

objectType.description: The type of object the field can be associated with.

selectableValues.description: Required when the field type is ValueSelect or MultiValueSelect. An array of selectable values for the field.

isDateOnlyField.description: Only applies to fields with an objectType of Date. Whether or not the field includes content other than a date

isExposableToCandidate.description: Determines whether the field can be exposed to a candidate in certain contexts. In order for a custom field to be available in an email template this value must be true.

post.description:
Get information about a custom field

**Requires the [`hiringProcessMetadataRead`](authentication#permissions-customfieldinfo) permission.**

customFieldId.description: The id of the custom field to fetch

isPrivate.description:
A boolean indicating whether the custom field is private. If not set, this value defaults to false.
Private custom fields can only be created and viewed by API keys with the "Allow access to non-offer 
private fields?" permission.

objectType.description: The type of object in Ashby the custom field is associated with

fieldType.description: The type of data stored in the custom field

selectableValues.description:
An array of values that can be selected for custom fields with a fieldType of MultiValueSelect.
If the fieldType is not MultiValueSelect, `selectableValues` will not be present in the response

post.description:
Lists all custom fields

**Requires the [`hiringProcessMetadataRead`](authentication#permissions-customfieldlist) permission.**

includeArchived.description: If true, archived custom fields will be included in the response

post.description:
Set the value of a custom field

**Requires the [`candidatesWrite`](authentication#permissions-customfieldsetvalue) permission.**

The values accepted in the `fieldValue` param depend on the type of field that's being updated. See below for more details:
  - Boolean - A boolean value
  - Date - An ISO Date string
  - Email, LongText, Phone, String - String
  - ValueSelect - A string that matches the value of one of the ValueSelect field's options
  - MultiValueSelect - An array of strings that exist in the MultiValueSelect field's options
  - Number - A number
  - NumberRange - An object with the following properties:
    - type: "number-range"
    - minValue: A number
    - maxValue: A number
  - CompensationRange - An object with the following properties:
    - type: "compensation-range"
    - minValue: A number
    - maxValue: A number
    - currencyCode: A string
    - interval: A valid interval string

allOf.description: The id of the object the field value is being set on.

objectType.description: The type of object the field is associated with.

allOf.description: The unique id of the Custom Field definition for the field

fieldValue.description: The value to store in the field

items.description: An array of strings that exist in the MultiValueSelect field's options

oneOf.title: ValueSelect
oneOf.description: A string that matches the value of one of the ValueSelect field's options

oneOf.title: NumberRange
oneOf.description: An object describing the number range

oneOf.title: CompensationRange
oneOf.description: An object describing the compensation range

post.description:
Creates a department

**Requires the [`organizationWrite`](authentication#permissions-departmentcreate) permission.**

parentId.description: The id of the department's parent department

post.description:
Fetch department details by id

**Requires the [`organizationRead`](authentication#permissions-departmentinfo) permission.**

allOf.description: The unique id of the department whose details will be fetched

post.description:
Lists all departments

**Requires the [`organizationRead`](authentication#permissions-departmentlist) permission.**

includeArchived.description: Whether archived departments should be included in the response

post.description:
Retrieve the url of a file associated with a candidate

**Requires the [`candidatesRead`](authentication#permissions-fileinfo) permission.**

**Please note** that running this with Ashby-generated demo data in an Ashby demo account can result in errors. We would recommend manually creating a test candidate in Ashby when trying out this endpoint.

fileHandle.description: A file handle retrieved from the public API

post.description:
Returns a single feedback form by id

**Requires the [`hiringProcessMetadataRead`](authentication#permissions-feedbackformdefinitioninfo) permission.**

allOf.description: The unique id of the feedback form you'd like to fetch.
The id of the interview associated with the feedback form.

post.description:
Lists all feedback forms

**Requires the [`hiringProcessMetadataRead`](authentication#permissions-feedbackformdefinitionlist) permission.**

Adds an Ashby user to the hiring team at the application or job-level. 

**Requires the [`organizationWrite`](authentication#permissions-hiringteamaddmember) permission.**

Hiring team members can be added to a hiring team at the application, job, or opening level.

allOf.description: The application to assign the user a role on.
The id of the user to assign the role to.
The id of the hiring team role to assign.
The job to assign the user a role on.
The id of the user to assign the role to.
The id of the hiring team role to assign.
The opening to assign the user a role on.
The id of the user to assign the role to.
The id of the hiring team role to assign.

post.description:
Lists the possible hiring team roles in an organization

**Requires the [`organizationRead`](authentication#permissions-hiringteamrolelist) permission.**

namesOnly.description: When set to true (the default), an array of role titles is returned. When set to false, an array of objects that include the id and title of the role is returned.

post.description:
Fetch interview details by id

**Requires the [`interviewsRead`](authentication#permissions-interviewinfo) permission.**

allOf.description: The unique id of the interview whose details will be fetched
The interview's id
Whether or not the interview is archived

isDebrief.description: Whether the interview is a debrief

instructionsHtml.description: An HTML version of the interview's description
instructionsHtml.example: The technical phone interview consists of a 60-minute series of technical questions

instructionsPlain.description: A plaintext version of the interview's description
instructionsPlain.example: The technical phone interview consists of a 60-minute series of technical questions

allOf.description:
The id of the job the interview is associated with. If null, the interview is not associated with a specific job
and is a shared interview. Interviews that are associated with particular jobs can only be scheduled for applications
to those jobs.
The id of the feedback form definition associated with the interview.

post.description:
List all interviews

**Requires the [`interviewsRead`](authentication#permissions-interviewlist) permission.**

includeNonSharedInterviews.description:
If true, interviews that are associated with specific jobs will be included in the response. 
Shared interviews that are not associated with a specific job can be scheduled for applications to any job.
Interviews that are not shared can only be scheduled for applications to the job they are associated with.

post.description:

expand.description: Choose to expand the result and include additional data for related objects.

The interview's id
The interview schedule's id

The time the interview event was created
The time the interview event is scheduled to start
The time the interview event is scheduled to end

feedbackLink.description: The link to submit feedback for the interview event

meetingLink.description: A link to the virtual meeting (if the interview is being hosted virtually)

hasSubmittedFeedback.description: Whether or not this interview has any feedback submitted

interview.description: The interview associated with this event (only included if the expand parameter includes "interview")

post.description:

allowReschedule.description: Whether or not this interview schedule can be rescheduled.

allOf.description: The id of the application for this interview schedule

interviewEvents.description: The list of events that make up this interview schedule

startTime.description: The start time of this event

endTime.description: The end time of this event

email.description: The email address of the user in Ashby

feedbackRequired.description: Whether this interviewer is required to provide feedback

post.description:
Gets all interview schedules in the organization.

allOf.description: The id of the application, for which to fetch interview schedules
The id of the interview stage, for which to fetch interview schedules

post.description:
Update an interview schedule. This endpoint allows you to add, cancel, or update interview events associated with an interview schedule.

**Requires the [`interviewsWrite`](authentication#permissions-interviewscheduleupdate) permission.**

In order to update an interview event on a schedule, the event's `interviewEventId` must be included when sending your request. 
`interviewEventId`s are included in the response of the `interviewSchedule.create` endpoint.

allOf.description:
The id of the interview schedule to update. 
Only interview schedules created using the API key making the request can be updated.

An event on the interview schedule to create or update.
To update an event, the event's `interviewEventId` must be included in the request.
The id of an interview event to update.

The id of the interview schedule to update. 
Only interview schedules created using the API key making the request can be updated.
The id of an interview event to cancel.

allowFeedbackDeletion.description: By default, we do not allow interview events with submitted feedback to be canceled because canceling an event causes its associated feedback to be deleted. If you want to allow events with submitted feedback to be canceled, this flag can be passed in and set to `true`. In this case, events with feedback will be canceled, and any associated feedback will be deleted.

Creates a new job

**Requires the [`jobsWrite`](authentication#permissions-jobcreate) permission.**

allOf.description: The id of the department or team associated with the job
The id of the location of the job

The id of the default interview plan for this job. 
A job cannot be opened without a default interview plan.

Only active job templates can be used to create a job.

post.description:
Returns details about a single job by id

**Requires the [`jobsRead`](authentication#permissions-jobinfo) permission.**

allOf.description: The id of the job to fetch

expand.description: Choose to expand the result and include additional data for related objects.

success.description: Whether the response is considered successful.

allOf.description: The location will only be included if the `location` expand parameter is included when the request is made.

openings.description: The openings array will only be included if the `openings` expand parameter is included when the request is made.

errors.description: A list of error message strings.

post.description:
List all open, closed, and archived jobs.

**Requires the [`jobsRead`](authentication#permissions-joblist) permission.**

To include draft jobs, `Draft` must be specified in the `status` param.

status.description: When supplied, only jobs with the provided status(es) will be returned.

openedAfter.description: Return jobs opened after this date, which is the time since the unix epoch in milliseconds

openedBefore.description: Return jobs opened before this date, which is the time since the unix epoch in milliseconds

closedAfter.description: Return jobs closed after this date, which is the time since the unix epoch in milliseconds

closedBefore.description: Return jobs closed before this date, which is the time since the unix epoch in milliseconds

post.description:
Sets the status on a job by id.

**Requires the [`jobsWrite`](authentication#permissions-jobsetstatus) permission.**

All jobs are drafts when they're first created. There are a few validations around the stages a job can be transitioned to:
- Drafts can be changed to Open or Archived
- Open jobs can be changed to Closed
- Closed jobs can be changed to Draft or Archived
- Archived jobs can be changed to a Draft

allOf.description: The unique id of the job to set the status of.
The status to apply to the job.

post.description:
Updates an existing job

**Requires the [`jobsWrite`](authentication#permissions-jobupdate) permission.**

allOf.description: The unique id of the job to update.

title.description: A new title for the job.

allOf.description: The new team to associate with the job.
The new location to associate with the job.
The new default interview plan to associate with the job.
The new default custom requisition id for the job.

title.description: The title of the job to search for

post.description:
Retrieve an individual job posting

**Requires the [`jobsRead`](authentication#permissions-jobpostinginfo) permission.**

Result fields:
- `linkedData` - Object that can be used to populate "rich results" in search engines. [See more info here](https://developers.google.com/search/docs/data-types/job-posting).
- `applicationFormDefinition` -	See the guide on [Creating a custom careers page](https://developers.ashbyhq.com/docs/creating-a-custom-careers-page).

allOf.description: The id of the job posting to return

expand.description: Choose to expand the result and include additional data for related objects.

allOf.description: The job posting's id

descriptionPlain.description: A plaintext version of the job posting's description
descriptionPlain.example:
This example role will be part of an example team and will report to the example manager. The new hire plays a critical role in various example workflows.



REQUIREMENTS

 - Experience writing good example job descriptions

 - Other exemplary skills

 - 3-5 years prior experience in this role

 - Motivation

 - Great english language skills
   


ABOUT THE TEAM


Example org is a leading software company. Example org allows real-time collaboration on important example workflows. Founded in 2012 we have over 10,000 customers worldwide and are backed by fantastic investors such as Sequoia Capital.

descriptionHtml.description: An HTML version of the job posting's description
descriptionHtml.example:

Requirements

About the Team


Example org is a leading software company. Example org allows real-time collaboration on important example workflows. Founded in 2012 we have over 10,000 customers worldwide and are backed by fantastic investors such as Sequoia Capital.

descriptionParts.description: The above description broken down into the actual description on the job, and the Job Post Description Opening and Closing that is set by the admin in Ashby's Job Boards  Theme  Messaging settings.

allOf.description: The content set in the Job Post Description Opening theme settings

html.description: An HTML version of the Job Post Description Opening theme settings

teamName.description: The name of the team associated with the job posting

teamNameHierarchy.description: The hierarchy of team names associated with the job posting.

allOf.description: The id of the job associated with the job posting

locationName.description: The name of the primary location associated with the job posting

linkedData.description: An object that can be used to populate "rich results" in search engines. (https://developers.google.com/search/docs/data-types/job-posting)

This example role will be part of an example team and will report to the example manager. The new hire plays a critical role in various example workflows.


Requirements

About the Team

publishedDate.description: The date the job posting was published

applicationDeadline.description: The date and time when applications will no longer be accepted

allOf.description: The address of the job posting

isRemote.description: Whether or not the job posting location is remote

allOf.description: The type of workplace.
See the guide on Creating a custom careers page (https://developers.ashbyhq.com/docs/creating-a-custom-careers-page)

isListed.description: Whether or not the job posting is listed

suppressDescriptionOpening.description: When true, the job description opening from the brand will be suppressed. descriptionOpening will be returned as null.

suppressDescriptionClosing.description: When true, the job description closing from the brand will be suppressed. descriptionClosing will be returned as null.

externalLink.description: The external link to the job posting. Will be null if the job posting is on an internal job board.

applyLink.description: The link to apply to the job posting. Will be to the public job board if the job posting is on an external job board, or to the internal job board if the job posting is on an internal job board.

compensation.description: Compensation ranges associated with the job posting and related settings

compensationTierSummary.description:
A summary of *all* the job posting's valid `compensationTiers` in the same format shown on
Ashby-hosted Job Boards

items.description:
A part of a compensation tier that represents one specific type of compensation, e.g. the "Salary"
or the "Bonus."

summary.description: The summary of this component in the same format shown on Ashby-hosted Job Boards

compensationType.description: The type of compensation this component represents

interval.description: The frequency at which this compensation is given

currencyCode.description:
For non `EquityPercentage` components, the [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217)
currency code of the compensation range

label.description: An optional label that describes this compensation range to applicants

minValue.description: The lower end of the compensation range

maxValue.description: The higher end of the compensation range

summaryComponents.description:
The maximum and minimum compensation ranges across *all* the posting's `compensationTiers`
that make up `compensationTierSummary`

items.description: A compensation range that can be offered to candidates

allOf.description: The compensation tier's unique id

title.description: A label that describes the entire range to applicants

items.description:
A part of a compensation tier that represents one specific type of compensation, e.g. the "Salary"
or the "Bonus."

allOf.description: The component's unique id

components.description: The individual components that make up this compensation range

tierSummary.description: A summary of the tiers's components in the same format shown on Ashby-hosted Job Boards

compensationTiers.description: The compensation ranges that can be offered to applicants for this posting

shouldDisplayCompensationOnJobBoard.description: Whether the job posting's settings specify that compensation should be shown to applicants

applicationLimitCalloutHtml.description: An HTML version of any communication you would like to show to applicants about the application limit for this job posting
applicationLimitCalloutHtml.example:
Please Note: we have set up limits for applications for this role. It is in the Product Limit group. The following limits apply to applications for all jobs within this group:

  • Candidates may not apply more than 1 time in any 60 day span for any job in the Product Limit Group.

post.description:
Lists all published job postings

**Requires the [`jobsRead`](authentication#permissions-jobpostinglist) permission.**

**Important**: By default, this endpoint includes all listed and unlisted job postings. Unlisted job postings should not be displayed publicly. 
If you are using the API to publicly expose job postings, set the `listedOnly` parameter to `true` when calling this API so that you only fetch listed job postings that can be displayed publicly.

listedOnly.description: If true, filter out unlisted job postings.

allOf.description: If provided, only returns the job postings on the specified job board.  If omitted, this API will return the job postings on the primary external job board.

post.description:
List all active and inactive job templates.

**Requires the [`jobsRead`](authentication#permissions-jobtemplatelist) permission.**

expand.description: Choose to expand the result and include additional data for related objects.

allOf.description: The id of the location of the job template
The id of the department or team associated with the job template

The id of the default interview plan for this job template. 
A job cannot be opened without a default interview plan.
The ids of all interview plans associated with a job template
The location will only be included if the `location` expand parameter is included when the request is made.

post.description:
Updates an existing job posting.

**Requires the [`jobsWrite`](authentication#permissions-jobpostingupdate) permission.**

**Note on updating the description**: When job description openings and closings are not suppressed, the `descriptionHtml` field returned in `jobPosting.info` may contain content that is not modifiable through the API. Only the content of the `descriptionParts.descriptionBody` field of the `jobPosting.info` endpoint is modifiable through this call. To completely customize the description, set both suppressDescriptionOpening and suppressDescriptionClosing to true.

allOf.description: The unique id of the job posting to update.

title.description: A new title for the job posting.

allOf.description: The type of workplace. LocationHierarchies cannot be labeled with a workplaceType.

suppressDescriptionOpening.description: When true, the job description opening from the brand will be suppressed. descriptionOpening will be returned as null.

suppressDescriptionClosing.description: When true, the job description closing from the brand will be suppressed. descriptionClosing will be returned as null.

description.description:
An HTML block of the job posting description. Please see below for supported tags.

**Note**: When job description openings and closings are not suppressed, the `descriptionHtml` field returned in `jobPosting.info` may contain content that is not modifiable through the API. Only the content of the `descriptionParts.descriptionBody` field of the `jobPosting.info` endpoint is modifiable through this call. To completely customize the description, set both suppressDescriptionOpening and suppressDescriptionClosing to true.

content.description:
The HTML content of the Job Posting. The following tags will accept updates. Updates to any other tags will be stripped out or not applied. 
- Headings - `<h[1-6]>`
- Bold - `<b>`
- Italic - `<i>`
- Underline - `<u>`
- Links - `<a>`
- Bulleted Lists - `<ul>`, `<li>`
- Ordered Lists - `<ol>`, `<li>`
- Code - `<code>`
- Code blocks - `<pre>`

post.description:
Creates a location or location hierarchy.

**Requires the [`organizationWrite`](authentication#permissions-locationcreate) permission.**

type.description: A Location represents an actual location that jobs and employees can be associated with. A Location Hierarchy is a grouping of locations or other location hierarchies.

addressCountry.description: The country the location is in. Must be a valid country name or two-letter country code.

addressRegion.description: The region the location is in (for instance, a state or province)

addressLocality.description: The city or town of the location

parentLocationId.description: The id of the location's parent

isRemote.description: Whether the location should be labeled as remote. LocationHierarchies cannot be labeled as remote.

allOf.description: The type of workplace. LocationHierarchies cannot be labeled with a workplaceType.

post.description:
Gets details for a single location by id.

**Requires the [`organizationRead`](authentication#permissions-locationinfo) permission.**

allOf.description: The id of the location to fetch

type.description: The type of the location component.

post.description:
List all locations. Regions are not returned.

**Requires the [`organizationRead`](authentication#permissions-locationlist) permission.**

includeLocationHierarchy.description: If true, the response will include the location hierarchy (regions).

post.description:
Creates a new Offer

**Requires the [`offersWrite`](authentication#permissions-offercreate) permission.**

Offer forms support a variety of field types. The values accepted for each field depend on the type of field that's being filled out:
- `Boolean` - A boolean value.
- `Currency` - An object in the format `{ currencyCode: "USD", value: 100000 }` where currencyCode is a valid ISO 4217 currency code and value is an integer.
- `Date` - A valid ISO Date string.
- `Number` - An integer.
- `String` - A string.
- `ValueSelect` - A string that matches the value of one of the ValueSelect field's selectable options.
- `MultiValueSelect` - An array of strings that exist in the MultiValueSelect field's selectable options.

allOf.description:
The id of the offer process associated with the offer you're creating. 
This value is the id included in the response of the `offerProcess.start` API.

The id of the form associated with the offer.
This value is the id included in the response of the `offer.start` API.

value.description: This is often a primitive but the value depends on the type of field being submitted. See the description above for details on the values accepted in this field.

post.description:
Returns details about a single offer by id

**Requires the [`offersRead`](authentication#permissions-offerinfo) permission.**

allOf.description: The id of the offer to fetch

post.description:
Get a list of all offers with their latest version

**Requires the [`offersRead`](authentication#permissions-offerlist) permission.**

allOf.description: If provided, only returns the offers for the application with the supplied id

post.description:
The offer.start endpoint creates and returns an offer version instance that can be filled out and submitted
using the `offer.create` endpoint. 

**Requires the [`offersWrite`](authentication#permissions-offerstart) permission.**

In order to create a new offer version for a candidate with an in-progress 
offer process, you can call the `offer.start` endpoint and then call the `offer.create` endpoint to fill out the
newly created offer version form.

allOf.description: The ID of the offer process to start. This value is the id included in the response of the `offerProcess.start` API.

type.description: The type of the form definition field.

post.description:
Starts an offer process for a candidate.

**Requires the [`offersWrite`](authentication#permissions-offerprocessstart) permission.**

allOf.description: The id of the application to start an offer process for
The id of the started offer process
The id of the application the offer process was started for

status.description: The status of the offer process

teamId.description: The id of the department or team associated with the opening.

locationIds.description: The ids of the locations associated with the opening.

jobIds.description: The ids of the jobs associated with the opening

targetHireDate.description: The date (in YYYY-MM-DD format) by which you intend to hire against this opening.

targetStartDate.description: The date (in YYYY-MM-DD format) by which you intend someone hired against this opening will start employment.

isBackfill.description: Whether this opening is intended to backfill a previous employee

**Requires the [`candidatesRead`](authentication#permissions-projectlist) permission.**

cursor.description: Opaque cursor indicating which page of results to fetch

syncToken.description: An opaque token representing the last time the data was successfully synced from the API. A new, updated one is returned after successfully fetching the last page of data.

limit.description: The maximum number of items to return. The maximum and default value is 100.

post.description:
Search for projects by title. 

**Requires the [`candidatesRead`](authentication#permissions-projectsearch) permission.**

Responses are limited to 100 results. Consider refining your search or using /project.list to paginate through all projects, if you approach this limit. This API is for use cases where you intend operate on a final small set of projects, like building a project autocomplete.

Creates a referral

**Requires the [`candidatesWrite`](authentication#permissions-referralcreate) permission.**

allOf.description: The id of the referral form, from /referralForm.info
The id of the user submitting the referral

value.description: This is often a primitive but for a referral job, it should be { title: job.title, value: job.id }

allOf.description: An ISO date string to set the referral's createdAt timestamp to. When this value isn't provided, the createdAt timestamp defaults to the time the referral was created.

post.description:
Fetches the default referral form or creates a default referral form if none exists.

**Requires the [`hiringProcessMetadataRead`](authentication#permissions-referralforminfo) permission.**

List all sources

**Requires the [`hiringProcessMetadataRead`](authentication#permissions-sourcelist) permission.**

List all source custom tracking links

**Requires the [`hiringProcessMetadataRead`](authentication#permissions-sourcetrackinglinklist) permission.**

includeDisabled.description: When true, includes disabled tracking links

post.description:
Returns details about a single survey form definition by id

**Requires the [`hiringProcessMetadataRead`](authentication#permissions-surveyformdefinitioninfo) permission.**

allOf.description: The id of the survey form to fetch

post.description:
Lists all survey form definitions.

**Requires the [`hiringProcessMetadataRead`](authentication#permissions-surveyformdefinitionlist) permission.**

This endpoint generates a survey request and returns a survey URL. You can send this URL to a candidate to allow them to complete a survey. 

**Requires the [`candidatesWrite`](authentication#permissions-surveyrequestcreate) permission.**

**Note that calling this endpoint will not automatically email the survey to the candidate.** It simply creates the request and gives you a URL to share with a candidate.

allOf.description: The id of the candidate to create a survey request for.
The id of the application to associate with the survey request.

The ID of the survey form that the candidate will see when they visit the URL returned in the `surveyURL` property of the API response. 
Survey forms IDs can be obtained using the `surveyFormDefinition.list` endpoint.
The id of the survey request
The id of the candidate the survey request is for
The id of the application associated with the survey request
The id of the survey form the candidate will fill out when they take the survey

surveyUrl.description: The URL that the candidate can visit to take the survey.

post.description:
Lists all survey requests

**Requires the [`candidatesRead`](authentication#permissions-surveyRequestList) permission.**

allOf.description: Returns only the survey requests of the given type. Currently, only `CandidateExperience` is supported.
If provided, only returns the offers for the application with the supplied id
If provided, only returns the offers for the candidate with the supplied id

post.description:
Create a new survey submission.

**Requires the [`candidatesWrite`](authentication#permissions-surveySubmissionCreate) permission.**

allOf.description: The id of the candidate to create a survey submission for.
The id of the application to associate with the survey submission.
The ID of the survey form definition that submissions are being provided for.

submittedValues.description:
The values that the candidate submitted in the survey form. 
The keys of this object should be the IDs from the associated survey's form definition, and the values should be the answers to the questions.
The information on what values are expected can be obtained by calling the `surveyFormDefinition.info` endpoint.

post.description:
Lists all survey submissions of a given `surveyType`.

**Requires the [`candidatesRead`](authentication#permissions-surveySubmissionList) permission.**

allOf.description: The type of survey submissions to fetch.

post.description:
Get an Ashby user by id

**Requires the [`organizationRead`](authentication#permissions-userinfo) permission.**

allOf.description: The id to lookup the user

post.description:
Get a list of all Ashby users

**Requires the [`organizationRead`](authentication#permissions-userlist) permission.**

The `globalRole` property in the response specifies the user's access level in Ashby.
For more details on the permissions granted with each role, see our [documentation here](https://ashbyhq.notion.site/Ashby-Permissions-a48eda7c07ad46f0bcd2b3f39301a9de#c64a4db5e7f4432bbe6691b91d3f0c62).

includeDeactivated.description:
If set to true, deactivated users are included in the response. 
By default, deactivated users are not included.

post.description:
Search for an Ashby user by email address

**Requires the [`organizationRead`](authentication#permissions-usersearch) permission.**

email.description: The email to use to search for the user

post.description:
Creates a webhook setting.

**Requires the [`apiKeysWrite`](authentication#permissions-webhookcreate) scope.**

requestUrl.description: The URL the webhook will send requests to.

secretToken.description: The secret token used to sign the webhook request. See our documentation [here](https://developers.ashbyhq.com/docs/authenticating-webhooks) for more information.

enabled.description: Whether or not the webhook setting is enabled.

requestUrl.description: The URL the webhook will send requests to.

secretToken.description: The secret token used to sign the webhook request. See our documentation [here](https://developers.ashbyhq.com/docs/authenticating-webhooks) for more information.

post.description:
Updates a webhook setting. One of `enabled`, `requestUrl`, or `secretToken` must be provided.

**Requires the [`apiKeysWrite`](authentication#permissions-webhookcreate) permission.**

allOf.description: The id of the webhook setting to update.

enabled.description: Whether or not the webhook is enabled.

requestUrl.description: The URL the webhook will send requests to.

secretToken.description: The secret token used to sign the webhook request. See our documentation [here](https://developers.ashbyhq.com/docs/authenticating-webhooks) for more information.

post.description:
Deletes a webhook setting.

**Requires the [`apiKeysWrite`](authentication#permissions-webhookcreate) permission.**

allOf.description: The id of the webhook setting to delete.
The id of the webhook setting that was deleted.

200.description: Return a 200 status to indicate that the data was received successfully

post.description:
The webhook is triggered when a candidate submits a non-anonymous survey. It will not fire for anonymous survey submissions.

Depending on the type of survey that was submitted, survey responses may be included in the webhook payload:
  - **Questionnaires**, **Candidate Data Consent** - Survey responses will be included in the payload.
  - **Candidate Experience** - If the submission is not anonymous, survey responses will be included in the payload. If the submission is anonymous, the webhook will not trigger.
  - **Diversity Surveys**, **EEOC Surveys** - Survey responses will never be included in the payload.

If survey responses are included in the payload, the `submittedValues` field will contain the submitted answers in an object where each key is the path of the field and the value is the value submitted for that field.

allOf.description: The id of the candidate who submitted the survey
The id of the application that the survey submission is associated with

200.description: Return a 200 status to indicate that the data was received successfully

BasicAuth.description:
Use HTTP Basic Auth to authenticate with our API. You must send your API key with every request. 
Put your API key as the basic auth username and leave the password blank.

WebhookSignature.name: Ashby-Signature
WebhookSignature.description:
[Optional] If you provide a secret token when configuring your webhook, this will be used to create a digest of the JSON payload sent with each webhook request.
The digest will be included in the request under the `Ashby-Signature` http header.

It will look like this:
`Ashby-Signature: sha256=f3124911d2956f10aa3a49c43a88bdf13bba846e94f0ae2bd7c034f90239bd04`

The part before the = indicates the algorithm that was used to compute the hash digest.
